title: What relation is Aurora to Maleficent in Angelia Jolie’s Mistress of Evil?
text:
Maleficent and Aurora aren’t blood relatives but do have a strong relationship (Picture: Disney)

Angelina Jolie is set to bring the legend of Sleeping Beauty back to the screen this weekend as she stars in the sequel Maleficent: Mistress Of Evil.

The fantasy epic – which metro.co.uk has called ‘stunning’ – sees Angelina reprise the role she played in 2014’s Maleficent, this time facing the prospect of Aurora (Elle Fanning) getting married, in a union which threatens to divide the human and fairy worlds forever.

The movie will of course have a hefty focus on the relationship between Maleficent and Aurora – but are the pair of them actually related?

Here’s what you need to know…

What relation is Aurora to Maleficent in Mistress of Evil?

Aurora is not actually a blood relative of Maleficent – in fact the Princess is the daughter of King Stefan and Queen Leila.

The character is set for conflict as Aurora’s impending marriage threatens the fairy kingdom (Picture: Disney)

However she is the adopted daughter of Aurora – who is protector of the Moors in the franchise, and is portrayed as a tragic, rather than evil, character.

The first film saw her break the curse she placed on Aurora to fall into a deep sleep after pricking her finger on a spinning wheel, by delivering the kiss that woke her up – with her motherly feelings towards her enough to lift the spell.

Elle Fanning reprises her role as Aurora (Picture: Disney)

She subsequently crowned Aurora queen of the Moors to unite the human and fairy kingdoms, following the death of her father Stefan.

What happens in Maleficent: Mistress of Evil?

The second film sees Maleficent facing a fresh challenge after Prince Phillip (Harris Dickinson) asks Aurora to marry him – which subsequently brings her face to face with his mother Queen Ingrith (Michelle Pfeiffer), who poses a serious threat to the fairy world, not to mention Maleficent’s relationship with Aurora.

The synopsis tells it thus: ‘A formidable queen causes a rift between Maleficent and Princess Aurora. Together, they must face new allies and enemies in a bid to protect the magical lands which they share.’

Who is in the cast of Maleficent: Mistress Of Evil?

Michelle Pfeiffer’s character could spell trouble (Picture: Disney)

As well as Jolie, Fanning and Pfeiffer, the cast also includes Chiwetel Ejiofor, Sam Riley, Robert Lindsay, Warwick Davis, Imelda Staunton and Juno Temple.

When is Maleficent: Mistress Of Evil released?

The film is released in UK cinemas on Friday 18 October.
